basics.name: Micah Tilton
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

work.summary: Identifying Linguistic Anti-Patterns in Data Science Projects: An Exploratory Study
highlights: Used a grounded theory-based approach to build a taxonomy of naming violations in 125 open-source data science projects
In-person poster board and powerpoint presentations

work.summary: Hawaii Trail Cam Fog Detection Using Machine Learning
highlights: Trained and tested multiple machine learning models on trail cam footage from all over the island
Created a simulated dataset of trail cam footage using Blender with volumetric fog

work.summary: Overview of the fundamentals of computer science emphasizing problem solving, algorithm development, implementation, and debugging/testing using an object-oriented programming language. Reinforce and strengthen problem solving skills using abstract data types and introduce software development practices.
highlights: Offered Computer Science tutoring and helped students during lab

work.summary: Introduced Computer Science Principles to highschool students interested in Computer Science
highlights: Created hands-on activities for the students to learn sorting algorithms
Taught Python using Jupyter Notebooks. Students were able to create a caeser cipher in Python after the summer workshop

awards.title: CNS Native Hawaiian Scholarship
awards.awarder: UH Manoa College of Natural Sciences
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to assist in recruiting and retaining Native Hawaiian students enrolled in the College of Natural Sciences at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa

awards.title: Hawaii Annual Code Challenge 2nd Place Coded Solution
awards.awarder: Transform Hawaii Government, Hawaiian Airlines, Verizon, Google for Government, Tyler Technologies, Microsoft, eWorld Enterprise Solutions, Salesforce, Hawaii Data Collaborative, AT&T and AWS
awards.summary: The HACC generates proof-of-concepts by student, amateur and professional coders to benefit community and State agencies to support sustainability at the idea-phase level, feeding into Hawai’i’s vibrant innovation ecosystem to promote solutions for the state, community, professional development, local job creation and building local businesses.
